text: With this representation, the problem of maximizing S(X′, Y′) is closely analogous to sequence alignment 19 and can be solved by a similar recursive method, schematized in Fig. 3 . Let N be the number of X′ codons, which is also the number of quartets. For any position k in the sequence, there are 4 4 = 256 possible quartets Q, which can be subdivided into four groups of 64, depending on their last nucleotide: Q(4) = A, C, G, or T.
